Abstract: This paper explores the intersection of financial economics and the COVID-19 pandemic, utilizing epidemiological models to assess impacts on financial stability and markets. It examines shifts in household behavior and the fixed income sector, highlighting the pandemic's role in reshaping economic landscapes. Through a multidisciplinary approach, the study aims to provide insights into the challenges and opportunities presented by COVID-19, offering a foundation for future research in financial economics amidst global health crises.
